What Is the Surfy Club?

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="39px"][vc_separator color="custom" el_width="40px" accent_color="#27323d"][gt3_spacing height="41px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#28323e" font_size="16" line_height="190"]

Welcome to the Surfy Club! We offer you a range of lessons and camps to choose from. Whether you are looking for private lessons, group lessons, day surf camps, or even stand up paddle board

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="30px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#909aa3" font_size="16"]

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="95px" responsive_es="true" height_mobile="55"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1526278230267{background-color: #28323e !important;}"][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="57px" responsive_es="true" height_mobile="27"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12" offset="vc_col-xs-7"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="30" responsive_font="true" font_size_mobile="26"]Our Lessons[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12" offset="vc_col-xs-5"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#909aa3" font_size="16"]

View All

[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][gt3_spacing height="22px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#c9d4dc" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Our proven learn to surf method is a systematic approach to teaching people the proper mechanics of the act of surfing. item.title: Lessons
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content" equal_height="yes" content_placement="middle" column_separator_row="" css=".vc_custom_1566219827820{margin-top: -80px !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1527680946779{background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/05/bg_lessons_07.jpg?id=3921) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_spacing height="445px"][/vc_column][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1527154993445{padding-left: 10.1% !important;background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/05/img_lessons_1-1.jpg?id=3329) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_spacing height="25px" responsive_es="true" height_tablet="84"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="30" line_height="100"]Corporate Lessons[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="27px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner css=".vc_custom_1526463008678{padding-right: 29% !important;}"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Let your staff overcome the obstacles of learning to surf together as a team. Have fun while becoming familiar with each other, bonding and experiencing something new and exciting! We know that your employees are very precious to your company and communication is crucial for a flourishing business[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][gt3_spacing height="37px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#909aa3" font_size="16"]

Learn More

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="49px" responsive_es="true" height_tablet="107"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content" equal_height="yes" content_placement="middle" reverse_columns_in_mobile="yes" column_separator_row=""][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1527155272664{padding-left: 29% !important;background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/05/img_lessons_2-2.jpg?id=3328) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_spacing height="25px" responsive_es="true" height_tablet="84"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="30" line_height="100"]Private Lessons[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="27px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner css=".vc_custom_1526464567328{padding-right: 15.9% !important;}"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#c9d4dc" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Surfy Clubs of international and local instructors will give you the special attention necessary in a private surf lesson. Our instructors will teach you the fundamentals which guide you through the tough process of learning how to surf. No matter your skill level, you will learn the basics of board handling, positioning, paddling[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][gt3_spacing height="37px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#909aa3" font_size="16"]

Learn More

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="49px" responsive_es="true" height_tablet="107"][/vc_column][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1527680508332{background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2017/05/img_lessons_01.jpg?id=3839) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_spacing height="445px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content" equal_height="yes" content_placement="middle"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1527680574746{background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2017/05/img_lessons_03.jpg?id=3840) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_spacing height="445px"][/vc_column][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1527155295210{padding-left: 10.1% !important;background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/05/img_lessons_3-3.jpg?id=3327) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_spacing height="25px" responsive_es="true" height_tablet="84"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="30" line_height="100"]Lessons for Kids[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="27px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner css=".vc_custom_1526464854064{padding-right: 31% !important;}"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Increase Your Child's Ocean Experience by enrolling them in one of our week long surf camps. We offer the most fun, safe and educational surf and skate camps! Camp options are full day and half day camps available for students ages 6 and older. We also offer combo surf and skate camp options[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][gt3_spacing height="37px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#909aa3" font_size="16"]

Learn More

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="49px" responsive_es="true" height_tablet="107"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content" equal_height="yes" content_placement="middle" reverse_columns_in_mobile="yes" column_separator_row=""][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1527155323773{padding-left: 29% !important;background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/05/img_lessons_4-4.jpg?id=3326) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_spacing height="25px" responsive_es="true" height_tablet="84"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="30" line_height="100"]Group Lessons[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="27px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner css=".vc_custom_1526464908960{padding-right: 15.9% !important;}"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#c9d4dc" font_size="16" line_height="190"]We are the leader in group packages! Group lessons are for groups of four to five people. Bring your friends and start your own group or meet new surfers in one of our group lessons.Group lessons are ideal for outgoing surfing enthusiasts who love meeting new people and sharing new experiences.[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][gt3_spacing height="37px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#909aa3" font_size="16"]

Learn More

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="49px" responsive_es="true" height_tablet="107"][/vc_column][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1527681039239{background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2017/01/lessons_02.jpg?id=3359) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}" offset="vc_col-md-6"][gt3_spacing height="445px"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: About Us
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1526459139145{margin-top: -80px !important;background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/05/bg_about_us_02.jpg?id=3280) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][gt3_spacing height="80px" responsive_es="true" height_mobile="0px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="30" line_height="160"]Why Learn from the Rest When You can Learn from the Best![/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#28323e" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Welcome to the Surfy Club! We offer you a range of lessons and camps to choose from. Whether you are looking for private lessons, group lessons, day surf camps, or even stand up paddle board lessons.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="17px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#28323e" font_size="16" line_height="190"]We have professional instructors highly trained in water safety and awareness, wave etiquette, board positioning, and wave knowledge who will encourage and guide you through your surfing progression.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="40px"][gt3_video_popup btn_color="#eb5e6e" title_size="14" video_title="see how we work" video_link="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=26KzUnEbTUs"][gt3_spacing height="120px" responsive_es="true" height_mobile="60"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1526458951439{background-color: #28323e !important;}"][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="57px" responsive_es="true" height_mobile="32"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="7/12"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="30" line_height="100"]Our Lessons[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="5/12"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#909aa3" font_size="16"]

View All

[/gt3_custom_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][gt3_spacing height="22px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#c9d4dc" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Our proven learn to surf method is a systematic approach to teaching people the proper mechanics of the act of surfing. Our lessons incorporate a land portion to learn about waves and test your balance and plenty of time in the water with our instructors to catch some waves![/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="44px"][gt3_practice_list posts_per_line="3" view_style="standard" show_filter="" show_pagination="" show_chart="110" show_readmore="yes" module_on_dark="yes" Welcome to the Surfy

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="60px" responsive_es="true" height_tablet="40"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]

Welcome to the Surfy Club! We offer you a range of lessons and camps to choose from. Whether you are looking for private lessons, group lessons, day surf camps, or even stand up paddle board lessons (SUP), Our Lessons is here to cater to your specific needs. For your convenience we offer surf lessons in our club.

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="44px"][vc_row_inner equal_height="yes" content_placement="middle"][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="18" line_height="150"]James W. item.title: How to Apply Surf Wax?
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
Before taking surf lessons in San Diego it is important to understand that the more than 70 miles of coastline in the county can be divided into three distinct areas: the North County coastal region, the central coast, and the South Bay coast. Each has its own well-known beaches and breaks that offer unique experiences for surfers of all abilities. The North County coastal region stretches from Del Mar up to Trestles.The majority of the beaches are south or southwestfacing and spots like Swamis, Tabletops, Lower, and Oceanside Harbor benefit from off-shore reefs, river mouths, and man-made jetties which allow for incredible breaks. These beaches are especially popular when a south swell comes in and combines with an offshore Santa Ana wind.The central coast, stretching from Point Loma to Torrey Pines offers the most diversity in its breaks. For example, you may want to head out to the jetties inSouth Mission or Ocean Beachwhere fast walls benefit those with short boards and better agility. Long waves at Tourmaline provide a slower ride for longboarders while the rocky coast at Sunset Cliffs and La Jolla have numerous right and left breaks that make good surf possible during swells of different directions, tidal conditions, and sizes. Those looking for bigger waves can head out toward the submarine canyons at Blacks Beach for big winter waves.

San Diego Surf Spots

The South Bay, from Imperial Beach north to Coronado, is another area worth checking out after youve taken San Diego surf classes. The low sand beaches in this area can haveformless waves which can be blownout by onshore wind, but when the surf is good it can be amazing. This is especially true in the south-facing north end of Coronado during the summer months.

Your Best Summer

Of course, finding the best surf spot is a matter of personal opinion. There are plenty of other breaks to choose from and some are far more crowded than others. Visit as many as you can and talk it over with more experienced friends to find your favorite. Be sure toalso check the surf report before headingout to find out the direction of the swells and the times of high and low tide, as these factors can greatly affect the surf. Before long you will have a handful of favorite San Diego surf spots of your own. To sign up for surf lessons contact Pacific Surf today.
Foam is your friend. Dont be scared of it. A little bit of extra foam here and there is good for the soul, and your surfing

Surf Lessons in San Diego

Surf wax is important to any surfer. After all, its what prevents you from slipping and falling off of your board. Its the surf wax that provides traction and grip on the board, without which all of the surf lessons in San Diego wouldnt help you catch a wave. Knowing how to apply surf wax in the right way could make the difference between catching the wave of your dreams or experiencing a heart-breaking wipeout. The first thing you should learn about wax as a part of your San Diego surf lessons is the difference between the distinct grades of surf wax.
item.excerpt:encoded: Surf wax is for the deck of the board, and keeps surfers from slipping off and falling. It creates grip and traction, which are much needed when surfing. For this reason, properly applying wax can be the difference between riding a wave and wiping out. Dont worry, waxing a board is relatively simple, but can be a challenge to the inexperienced surfers...

item.excerpt:encoded: To be able to surf you only need a surfboard and some waves, right? Yeah, this is somewhat right, but the reality is that you will need come accessories to be safe in the water, as well as the other people around you. Leashes and fins are necessary, while nose guards are optional, but you should also use them...

Paragraph

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="19px"][vc_column_text]If you ask any of us what the best things to do in San Diego are, well gladly tip you off on a hundred different awesome ways to spend your time, with surfing always being near or at the top of the list. Surfing is something anyone can take up at just about any age. From six to sixty, weve got wave riders out every day enjoying the summer sun and rolling Pacific Ocean waters. Its something quite addicting and we find that once you start, you wont ever want to stop. If youre a novice to surfing, no worries, our surf instructors are required to be ocean safety certified and can give you the knowledge you need to enjoy the surf lesson. Hooking up with an instructor is as easy as calling us or requesting a lesson online. Before you know it, youll be cruising waves and speaking the local surf lingo like youve been doing it for years. In California, were known for our beautiful weather and San Diego is no exception. In Americas most bike friendly city, you can find bikers leisurely moving along the boardwalk taking in the sights and sounds of the milling crowds. Its a perfect way to get your exercise, while maintaining the ability to stop at any point on your ride to enjoy the many things that might catch your eye. Mission Bay is the perfect spot if youre looking for more of a laid-back ride with scenic enjoyment, offering 12 miles of virtually car-free bike paths.[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="49px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="30" line_height="100%"]

Highlighters

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]If you ask any of us what the best things to do in San Diego are, well gladly tip you off on a hundred different awesome ways to spend your time, with surfing always being near or at the top of the list. Surfing is something anyone can take up at just about any age. From six to sixty, weve got wave riders out every day enjoying the summer sun and rolling Pacific Ocean waters. Its something quite addicting and we find that once you start, you wont ever want to stop. If youre a novice to surfing, no worries, our surf instructors are required to be ocean safety certified and can give you the knowledge you need to enjoy the surf lesson. Hooking up with an instructor is as easy as calling us or requesting a lesson online. Before you know it, youll be cruising waves and speaking the local surf lingo like youve been doing it for years.[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="49px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation="fadeInUp" css=".vc_custom_1484820373597{padding-bottom: 39px !important;}"][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="30" line_height="100%"]

Dropcaps

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="19px"][vc_column_text]From six to sixty, weve got wave riders out every day enjoying the summer sun and rolling Pacific Ocean waters. Its something quite addicting and we find that once you start, you wont ever want to stop. If youre a novice to surfing, no worries, our surf instructors are required to be ocean safety certified and can give you the knowledge you need to enjoy the surf lesson. Hooking up with an instructor is as easy as calling us or requesting a lesson online. Before you know it, youll be cruising waves and speaking the local surf lingo like youve been doing it for years.[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="10px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation="fadeInUp" css=".vc_custom_1484820373597{padding-bottom: 39px !important;}"][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="30" line_height="100%"]

Blockquote

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="21px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#777b93" font_size="30"]

Foam is your friend. Don't be scared of it. A little bit of extra foam here and there is good for the soul, and your surfing

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="16" line_height="225%"]

by Rob Machado

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="7px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="30" line_height="100%"]

Standard Listings

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="16px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_column_text]

  2. Water Safety Certification
  3. Five years personal surfing experience
  4. Be at least 19 years of age
  5. Good communication skills

Wave is Surf[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="21px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Simply put, because its awesome! You get to spend time outdoors, enjoy the energizing power of the ocean, hang out with other wave enthusiasts and really do something special for yourself[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="32px"][vc_progress_bar values="%5B%7B%22label%22%3A%22Corporate%20Lessons%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2280%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23eb5e6e%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%2327323d%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22private%20Lessons%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2260%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23eb5e6e%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%2327323d%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22lessons%20for%20kids%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2285%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23eb5e6e%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%2327323d%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22group%20lessons%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2245%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%23eb5e6e%22%2C%22customtxtcolor%22%3A%22%2327323d%22%7D%5D" bgcolor="custom" units="%" custombgcolor="#e9ebed" customtxtcolor="#27323d"][gt3_spacing height="120px" responsive_es="true" height_mobile="50"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1526477322485{background-color: #28323e !important;}"][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="56px" responsive_es="true" height_mobile="36"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="30"]Frequently Asked Questions[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="21px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#c9d4dc" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Our proven learn to surf method is a systematic approach to teaching people the proper mechanics of the act of surfing. Our lessons incorporate a land portion to learn about waves and test your balance and plenty of time in the water with our instructors to catch some waves![/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="40px"][vc_toggle title="Why is the Surfy Club?" style="accordion_alternative" color="triangle" size="right" open="true"]Surfy is the best surf school worldwide! With numerous camps located in; San Diego, Los Angeles, Costa Rica, Bali, Brazil, and Hawaii. Our club has a locale perfect for your learning desire. Awarded Best surf school by the San Diego Union Tribune, Pacific Surf School guarantees to have you standing by the end of your first lesson.[/vc_toggle][vc_toggle title="What should I bring to a Surfy Club surf class?" style="accordion_alternative" color="triangle" size="right"]Surfy is the best surf school worldwide! With numerous camps located in; San Diego, Los Angeles, Costa Rica, Bali, Brazil, and Hawaii. Our club has a locale perfect for your learning desire. Awarded Best surf school by the San Diego Union Tribune, Pacific Surf School guarantees to have you standing by the end of your first lesson.[/vc_toggle][vc_toggle title="What should I do if I wear contacts?" style="accordion_alternative" color="triangle" size="right"]Surfy is the best surf school worldwide! item.title: Things to do in San Diego in September
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
Before taking surf lessons in San Diego it is important to understand that the more than 70 miles of coastline in the county can be divided into three distinct areas: the North County coastal region, the central coast, and the South Bay coast. Each has its own well-known beaches and breaks that offer unique experiences for surfers of all abilities. The North County coastal region stretches from Del Mar up to Trestles.The majority of the beaches are south or southwestfacing and spots like Swamis, Tabletops, Lower, and Oceanside Harbor benefit from off-shore reefs, river mouths, and man-made jetties which allow for incredible breaks. These beaches are especially popular when a south swell comes in and combines with an offshore Santa Ana wind.The central coast, stretching from Point Loma to Torrey Pines offers the most diversity in its breaks. For example, you may want to head out to the jetties inSouth Mission or Ocean Beachwhere fast walls benefit those with short boards and better agility. Long waves at Tourmaline provide a slower ride for longboarders while the rocky coast at Sunset Cliffs and La Jolla have numerous right and left breaks that make good surf possible during swells of different directions, tidal conditions, and sizes. Those looking for bigger waves can head out toward the submarine canyons at Blacks Beach for big winter waves.

San Diego Surf Spots

The South Bay, from Imperial Beach north to Coronado, is another area worth checking out after youve taken San Diego surf classes. The low sand beaches in this area can haveformless waves which can be blownout by onshore wind, but when the surf is good it can be amazing. This is especially true in the south-facing north end of Coronado during the summer months.

Your Best Summer

Of course, finding the best surf spot is a matter of personal opinion. There are plenty of other breaks to choose from and some are far more crowded than others. Visit as many as you can and talk it over with more experienced friends to find your favorite. Be sure toalso check the surf report before headingout to find out the direction of the swells and the times of high and low tide, as these factors can greatly affect the surf. Before long you will have a handful of favorite San Diego surf spots of your own. To sign up for surf lessons contact Pacific Surf today.
Foam is your friend. Dont be scared of it. A little bit of extra foam here and there is good for the soul, and your surfing

Surf Lessons in San Diego

Surf wax is important to any surfer. After all, its what prevents you from slipping and falling off of your board. Its the surf wax that provides traction and grip on the board, without which all of the surf lessons in San Diego wouldnt help you catch a wave. Knowing how to apply surf wax in the right way could make the difference between catching the wave of your dreams or experiencing a heart-breaking wipeout. The first thing you should learn about wax as a part of your San Diego surf lessons is the difference between the distinct grades of surf wax.
item.excerpt:encoded: Summer may be winding down, but here in San Diego we still have plenty of events lined up to enjoy all through the month of September. Whether youre looking for an adrenaline rush or a relaxing way to spend the day, theres something for all of us. If you ask any of us what the best things to do in San Diego are, well gladly tip you off on a hundred...

item.title: Lessons for Kids
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="9px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="36"]Lessons for Kids[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Surfy Clubs of international and local instructors will give you the special attention necessary in a private surf lesson. Our instructors will teach you the fundamentals which guide you through the tough process of learning how to surf. No matter your skill level, you will learn the basics of board handling, positioning, paddling, various techniques on getting to your feet, surfing etiquette, ocean knowledge, and water safety.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="17px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Even though group lessons are great fun, some people prefer learning on their own. We completely understand, which is why we want to make it as convenient as possible for them to choose the time from our timetable that suits them best (subject to availability). Some people are just shy when trying to learn something new, which is another reason why they go for private rather than group surf lessons. It gives them the opportunity to ask all the questions they might otherwise be too embarrassed to ask.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="32px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="24"]Our Instructors[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="24px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Our team of certified and experienced instructors values the individuality of every surf student, be it in a group or private lesson, but some students still prefer the undivided attention of their instructor. This is natural and understandable, which is why we reach out to surf lovers throughout San Diego and offer quality private surfing classes in Pacific Beach, Ocean Beach and Mission Beach.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="30px"][gt3_team use_filter="" posts_per_line="3" build_query="size:3|order_by:date"][gt3_spacing height="23px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="24"]What is Expected in a Lessons[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="32px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16"]
  1. Training - in our 30 minute land portion of the lesson, you will learn and practice a variety of different pop up techniques that you will need to know before heading out into the ocean to catch your waves.
  2. Wave Riding - now that you have learned the basics of safety and pop ups, its time to put your new skills to the test! Spend the rest of the time in the ocean surfing with your instructor.
  3. Knowledge - basic wave reading including all possible factors.
  4. Safety - water safety and ocean awareness, basic ocean safety paddling and positioning on the board.
[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="11px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="24" line_height="150"]Surfy is a licensed business & permitted surf school and camp. Due to high volume, we encourage you to book your lessons online right now to warranty your lesson.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1526470456370{background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/04/lessons_01-2.jpg?id=3355) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="80" use_theme_fonts="" google_fonts_text="font_family:Kaushan%20Script%3Aregular|font_style:400%20regular%3A400%3Anormal" responsive_font="true" font_size_tablet="60" font_size_mobile="46"]

Interested in Our Lessons?

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="18" line_height="190"]

We look forward to seeing you surf with us!

[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="29px"][gt3_button button_title="book now" button_alignment="center" btn_border_radius="3px" use_theme_button="" btn_bg_color="#ffffff" btn_text_color="#eb5e6e" btn_bg_color_hover="#eb5e6e" btn_text_color_hover="#ffffff" btn_icon_color="#ffffff" btn_icon_color_hover="#ffffff" btn_border_color="#ffffff" btn_border_color_hover="#eb5e6e" link="url:https%3A%2F%2Flivewp.site%2Fwp%2Fmd%2Fsurfy%2Fservice-request%2F|||"][gt3_spacing height="25px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="60px"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

  2. Wave Riding - now that you have learned the basics of safety and pop ups, its time to put your new skills to the test! Spend the rest of the time in the ocean surfing with your instructor.
  3. Knowledge - basic wave reading including all possible factors.
  4. Safety - water safety and ocean awareness, basic ocean safety paddling and positioning on the board.
[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="11px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="24" line_height="150"]Surfy is a licensed business & permitted surf school and camp. Due to high volume, we encourage you to book your lessons online right now to warranty your lesson.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1526470456370{background-image: url(https://livewp.site/wp/md/surfy/wp-content/uploads/sites/43/2018/04/lessons_01-2.jpg?id=3355) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#ffffff" font_size="80" use_theme_fonts="" google_fonts_text="font_family:Kaushan%20Script%3Aregular|font_style:400%20regular%3A400%3Anormal" responsive_font="true" font_size_tablet="60" font_size_mobile="46"]

item.title: Private Lessons
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="9px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="36"]Private Lessons[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="18px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Surfy Clubs of international and local instructors will give you the special attention necessary in a private surf lesson. Our instructors will teach you the fundamentals which guide you through the tough process of learning how to surf. No matter your skill level, you will learn the basics of board handling, positioning, paddling, various techniques on getting to your feet, surfing etiquette, ocean knowledge, and water safety.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="17px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Even though group lessons are great fun, some people prefer learning on their own. We completely understand, which is why we want to make it as convenient as possible for them to choose the time from our timetable that suits them best (subject to availability). Some people are just shy when trying to learn something new, which is another reason why they go for private rather than group surf lessons. It gives them the opportunity to ask all the questions they might otherwise be too embarrassed to ask.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="32px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="24"]Our Instructors[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="24px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16" line_height="190"]Our team of certified and experienced instructors values the individuality of every surf student, be it in a group or private lesson, but some students still prefer the undivided attention of their instructor. This is natural and understandable, which is why we reach out to surf lovers throughout San Diego and offer quality private surfing classes in Pacific Beach, Ocean Beach and Mission Beach.[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="30px"][gt3_team use_filter="" posts_per_line="3" build_query="size:3|order_by:date"][gt3_spacing height="23px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="24"]What is Expected in a Lessons[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="32px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#737d84" font_size="16"]

  2. Wave Riding - now that you have learned the basics of safety and pop ups, its time to put your new skills to the test! Spend the rest of the time in the ocean surfing with your instructor.
  3. Knowledge - basic wave reading including all possible factors.
  4. Safety - water safety and ocean awareness, basic ocean safety paddling and positioning on the board.
[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="11px"][gt3_custom_text text_color="#27323d" font_size="24" line_height="150"]Surfy is a licensed business & permitted surf school and camp. item.title: How to Pick the Right Board for You
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
Before taking surf lessons in San Diego it is important to understand that the more than 70 miles of coastline in the county can be divided into three distinct areas: the North County coastal region, the central coast, and the South Bay coast. Each has its own well-known beaches and breaks that offer unique experiences for surfers of all abilities. The North County coastal region stretches from Del Mar up to Trestles.The majority of the beaches are south or southwestfacing and spots like Swamis, Tabletops, Lower, and Oceanside Harbor benefit from off-shore reefs, river mouths, and man-made jetties which allow for incredible breaks. These beaches are especially popular when a south swell comes in and combines with an offshore Santa Ana wind.The central coast, stretching from Point Loma to Torrey Pines offers the most diversity in its breaks. For example, you may want to head out to the jetties inSouth Mission or Ocean Beachwhere fast walls benefit those with short boards and better agility. Long waves at Tourmaline provide a slower ride for longboarders while the rocky coast at Sunset Cliffs and La Jolla have numerous right and left breaks that make good surf possible during swells of different directions, tidal conditions, and sizes. Those looking for bigger waves can head out toward the submarine canyons at Blacks Beach for big winter waves.

San Diego Surf Spots

The South Bay, from Imperial Beach north to Coronado, is another area worth checking out after youve taken San Diego surf classes. The low sand beaches in this area can haveformless waves which can be blownout by onshore wind, but when the surf is good it can be amazing. This is especially true in the south-facing north end of Coronado during the summer months.

Your Best Summer

Of course, finding the best surf spot is a matter of personal opinion. There are plenty of other breaks to choose from and some are far more crowded than others. Visit as many as you can and talk it over with more experienced friends to find your favorite. Be sure toalso check the surf report before headingout to find out the direction of the swells and the times of high and low tide, as these factors can greatly affect the surf. Before long you will have a handful of favorite San Diego surf spots of your own. To sign up for surf lessons contact Pacific Surf today.
Foam is your friend. Dont be scared of it. A little bit of extra foam here and there is good for the soul, and your surfing
 

Surf Lessons in San Diego

Surf wax is important to any surfer. After all, its what prevents you from slipping and falling off of your board. Its the surf wax that provides traction and grip on the board, without which all of the surf lessons in San Diego wouldnt help you catch a wave. Knowing how to apply surf wax in the right way could make the difference between catching the wave of your dreams or experiencing a heart-breaking wipeout. The first thing you should learn about wax as a part of your San Diego surf lessons is the difference between the distinct grades of surf wax.

Its the surf wax that provides traction and grip on the board, without which all of the surf lessons in San Diego wouldnt help you catch a wave. Knowing how to apply surf wax in the right way could make the difference between catching the wave of your dreams or experiencing a heart-breaking wipeout. The first thing you should learn about wax as a part of your San Diego surf lessons is the difference between the distinct grades of surf wax.
item.excerpt:encoded: To be able to surf you only need a surfboard and some waves, right? Yeah, this is somewhat right, but the reality is that you will need come accessories to be safe in the water, as well as the other people around you. Leashes and fins are necessary, while nose guards are optional, but you should also use them...

item.title: Link Post
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
Before taking surf lessons in San Diego it is important to understand that the more than 70 miles of coastline in the county can be divided into three distinct areas: the North County coastal region, the central coast, and the South Bay coast. Each has its own well-known beaches and breaks that offer unique experiences for surfers of all abilities. The North County coastal region stretches from Del Mar up to Trestles.The majority of the beaches are south or southwestfacing and spots like Swamis, Tabletops, Lower, and Oceanside Harbor benefit from off-shore reefs, river mouths, and man-made jetties which allow for incredible breaks. These beaches are especially popular when a south swell comes in and combines with an offshore Santa Ana wind.The central coast, stretching from Point Loma to Torrey Pines offers the most diversity in its breaks. For example, you may want to head out to the jetties inSouth Mission or Ocean Beachwhere fast walls benefit those with short boards and better agility. Long waves at Tourmaline provide a slower ride for longboarders while the rocky coast at Sunset Cliffs and La Jolla have numerous right and left breaks that make good surf possible during swells of different directions, tidal conditions, and sizes. Those looking for bigger waves can head out toward the submarine canyons at Blacks Beach for big winter waves.

San Diego Surf Spots

The South Bay, from Imperial Beach north to Coronado, is another area worth checking out after youve taken San Diego surf classes. The low sand beaches in this area can haveformless waves which can be blownout by onshore wind, but when the surf is good it can be amazing. This is especially true in the south-facing north end of Coronado during the summer months.

Your Best Summer

Of course, finding the best surf spot is a matter of personal opinion. There are plenty of other breaks to choose from and some are far more crowded than others. Visit as many as you can and talk it over with more experienced friends to find your favorite. Be sure toalso check the surf report before headingout to find out the direction of the swells and the times of high and low tide, as these factors can greatly affect the surf. Before long you will have a handful of favorite San Diego surf spots of your own. To sign up for surf lessons contact Pacific Surf today.

Knowing how to apply surf wax in the right way could make the difference between catching the wave of your dreams or experiencing a heart-breaking wipeout. The first thing you should learn about wax as a part of your San Diego surf lessons is the difference between the distinct grades of surf wax.

item.title: Softech Flash Performance FCSII Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded: A super short and fat hybrid shape with enough volume in the nose and under the chest for impressive paddle power but with a pulled in tail to allow for tighter turns in faster and hollower waves. This board really bridges the gap between a user-friendly softboard and a high-performance hard skin board.

This board really bridges the gap between a user-friendly softboard and a high-performance hard skin board.

item.title: Channel Islands High 5 FCSII 5 Fin Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded: The Channel Islands High 5 is a fun and forgiving shortboard that adds a touch of performance to ensure this board is enjoyable for any skill level. The hybrid-fish outline should increase your wave count whilst being faster and livelier than its cousin, the Average Joe. A single concave enters the bottom before running into a double section through the fins and finally leaving the tail in a deep vee. Earning its name from its stock 5 fin boxes, the High 5 allows you to ride this as a quad or thruster. Its recommended you ride this board 3 to 5 inches shorter than your height. You should have a lot of fun riding this board in a range of different conditions.
item.excerpt:encoded: The Channel Islands High 5 is a fun and forgiving shortboard that adds a touch of performance to ensure this board is enjoyable for any skill level. The hybrid-fish outline should increase your wave count whilst being faster and livelier than its cousin, the Average Joe. A single concave enters the bottom before running into a double section through the fins and finally leaving the tail in a deep vee. Earning its name from its stock 5 fin boxes, the High 5 allows you to ride this as a quad or thruster. Its recommended you ride this board 3 to 5 inches shorter than your height. You should have a lot of fun riding this board in a range of different conditions.

item.title: Vision Ignite Soft Deck & Slick Bottom Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded: The Vision Ignite Soft Deck is all about accessibility. This board is for everybody and offers super fun rides at an affordable price. Whether you're after your first board or something for smaller days, the Ignite will see you up and riding in no time.

item.title: Vision Ignite Soft Deck & Slick Bottom Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john

item.title: Maluku Flying Frog Eco 5 Fin Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded: It's every surfers dilemma, particularly when the waves are small or weak: You want to get in the water, you want to catch waves, you need the board to help you generate speed BUT you still want to be able to lay it on a rail and throw a little spray.The trend for super fat shortboards has created a lot of fun shapes for surfers of all levels, but unless you're a WCT contender their fat tails can be hard to control properly rail to rail once you do get the board moving. The Maluku Flying Frog solves this problem by creating something of cut and shut; The front end is similar to a traditional egg or even minimal, but the tail is all rounded pin shortboard. You paddle in early and easy on that reassuring front end foam, pump through on your front foot on that wide, stable middle section and when you're ready weight the back foot and put the board on rail exactly as you would with a shortboard - the rounded pin tail gives control through the turn in gutless waves or hold AND control in larger surf.
item.excerpt:encoded: Entropy Resins makes thermoset epoxy systems for a new generation of products. Products that not only perform, but also take a crucial step towards lowering our impact on the environment.

item.title: Maluku Flying Frog Eco 5 Fin Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john

item.title: Catch Surf Johnny Redmond Pro Model Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
The All-new Original 54 PRO is the gnarliest Beater yet! Built for next-level shredding with a new removable fin system allowing for harder carves and added drive. Match that with custom-colored decks, rad graphic bottoms and youve got one bad ass shred stick!
Features a strong, light-weight and water-resistant core with dual (x2) maple-ply wood stringers and high-density bottom to make it the stiffest most durable Beater ever made! All Original PRO models are equipped with the new hi-performance fin system and 4 Beater PRO model Keel fins.

item.title: Catch Surf Johnny Redmond Pro Model Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john

item.title: Creative Army Seahorse PU Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
The Seahorse, is a classic, stylish, single fin Longboard. A traditional outline with a wider nose and chopped square tail is a throwback to the 60s. Designed for fun small to mid-sized waves where you all you want is long rides and easy paddling.
Creative Army set the seahorse up with a low rocker through the front and midsection while the flipped tail helps you reposition in the pocket. A deep concave creates lift through the nose before flattening in the midsection for speed and finally rolling out as a vee in the tail for transitions. A blast from the past that any Longboard surfer will enjoy in their quiver.
item.excerpt:encoded: The Seahorse, is a classic, stylish, single fin Longboard. A traditional outline with a wider nose and chopped square tail is a throwback to the 60s. Designed for fun small to mid-sized waves where you all you want is long rides and easy paddling.

item.title: Pyzel Slab 2.0 Futures Thruster Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded: The legend John John florence's board of choice Template: Shorter and wider than an average shortboard with the wide point being further forward Nose: Shorter and wider, that paddles like a dream and adds ridiculous amounts of speed Tail The squash tail offers great responsiveness and versatility as they hold in big waves and go great smaller waves Concave: Deep, full concave that starts in the nose and blends into deep double concave through the back 1/3 of the board Rocker: The Slab 2.0 has a flat rocker through the entry with the rocker of a high performance short board through the tail Rider ability: Beginner right through to professional Suitable conditions: Everything from a hollow point break through to a mushy beach break Wave height: 1 - 6 ft Fin system: Futures thruster set up (Fins not included) Rails: Slightly fuller than normal rails that help distribute the extra volume

item.title: Maluku Fish Cake MKII Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded: The MKII of the Fish Cake from Maluku includes a wing in the tail and 5 fin plugs so that you can ride it as either a thruster or a quad, depending on what you prefer. The wing pulls the tail in providing extra hold giving you a little more confidence when the waves are good. Extra foam under the chest for paddle speed, forgiving rails that will help anyone start to improve their turns and a nice relaxed template mean this would be a great first shortboard for anyone stepping down from a longer mini mal, or for the competent shortboarder looking for extra volume. It's why the fish is one of the most versatile shorter boards you can think off. Small, gutless waves, lined up walls, hold and drive when it gets a little bigger - it covers the bases while remaining a blast to surf.

item.title: Fourth Summer Series Weekend Rockstar Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
The Fourth Summer Series surfboards are an exclusive range of individually numbered boards for Surfdome. Inspired by the flavours of a summer visit to the ice cream parlour, each board will have its own unique resin swirl tint. These amazing looking boards are constructed using Fourths ESE technology and are sure to turn an eye on your next surfing mission.
Starting with the outline, this board has the look of a fish; a wider nose and pulled in swallow tail, but when you really dissect the Weekend Rockstars outline you start to see the secrets. The parallel rails give this fish heaps of forward trajectory and the bullet like tail curves offer great pivot when needed through turns. The nose, although wide, has a fast curve for the overall length of the board to make sure there are no issues with bogging rails and bigger turns in weaker waves. The rocker is medium throughout with slight kick in the tail to keep it lively, and the foil is that of a high-performance all-rounder - which in this case was based on the shank.
item.excerpt:encoded: The Fourth Summer Series surfboards are an exclusive range of individually numbered boards for Surfdome. These amazing looking boards are constructed using Fourths ESE technology and are sure to turn an eye on your next surfing mission.

item.title: Fourth Bearman Pro ESE Construction FCSII 5 Fin Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded: Adam Bearman Griffiths has had an amazing couple of years at Fourth Surfboards winning British titles, placing runner up in the Europeans, and placing in the worlds top 25 longboarders! Fourth have been tweaking his boards so much over the years and have come across a hybrid of two models that Bearman previously surfed in different conditions. Characteristically, the aims are the same; nose rides and flow, with a performance edge on rail. This board has high entry and exit rocker to accentuate rail work on waves with a pocket. The bottom shapes complement this rocker curve with a single through the nose and a slightly wider nose template than the original Bearman Pro. This offers quick response to speed manipulation and a nice platform to engage the fins when nose riding. Add this approach to the wider overall template of the 2016 model; the harder rails in the back half of the board and the softer boat rails through the nose, and you have yourself a highly responsive, stable platform that is easy to move about in a range of conditions.

item.title: Fourth Summer Series Chilli Bean Surfboard
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
The Fourth Summer Series surfboards are an exclusive range of individually numbered boards for Surfdome. Inspired by the flavours of a summer visit to the ice cream parlour, each board will have its own unique resin swirl tint. These amazing looking boards are constructed using Fourths ESE technology and are sure to turn an eye on your next surfing mission.
The Chilli Bean is built for any surfer who understands that if you're not afraid of slightly more foam you can go shorter than you'd imagined possible. For 2018, Fourth have taken some foam off the rail to add an element of ease to turning the board as well as carbon support through the engaged part of the board when surfing down the line, freeing some flex up in the tail to give a bit more torque through your turns.

item.title: O'Neill Womens 2019 Epic 5/4mm Back Zip Wetsuit
item.dc:creator: john
item.content:encoded:
The ONeill Epic is a value for money wetsuit. High-end features and sleek graphics make this a great option for surfers looking to upgrade from an entry level suit.
Made using Ultraflex neoprene that has a durable outer skin and has stretch abilities up to 150%. The seams are glued, blind stitched and have inner tape on the key stress points throughout the suit, to further lock water out of the suit the neck has a double super seal.
Getting into the suit is really easy through the back-zip entry system, this will ensure youre not feeling the cold too much when youre getting suited up!

item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Personal Experience

[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="24px"][vc_column_text]Our team of certified and experienced instructors values the individuality of every surf student, be it in a group or private lesson, but some students still prefer the undivided attention of their instructor. This is natural and understandable, which is why we reach out to surf lovers throughout San Diego and offer quality private surfing classes in Pacific Beach, Ocean Beach and Mission Beach. Even though group lessons are great fun, some people prefer learning on their own. We completely understand, which is why we want to make it as convenient as possible for them to choose the time from our timetable that suits them best[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="33px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1485243736345{padding-bottom: 30px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1525695860758{margin-bottom: 15px !important;}"]

Skills

[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="8px"][vc_progress_bar values="%5B%7B%22label%22%3A%22surfing%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2280%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22windsurfing%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2260%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22kitesurfing%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2285%22%7D%5D" units="%"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1525695881406{margin-bottom: 15px !important;}"]

Surf Lessons

[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="4px"][vc_column_text]
  1. Corporate lessons for begginers
  2. Private lessons for woman
  3. Lessons for kids and adults
  4. Group Lessons for any ages
  5. Private Lessons for professionals
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_spacing height="2px"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1525696019509{margin-bottom: 15px !important;}"]

Certification

[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="8px"][vc_column_text]Surfy has provided safe, fun, and exciting surf lessons and camps for the past 14 years! Founded in 2000 our club continuously provides the best surf instruction to inexperienced and experienced surfers alike. Our friendly, highly trained and certified instructors will guide you through an informative and uncomfortable process of learning how to surf.[/vc_column_text][gt3_spacing height="15px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][gt3_custom_text text_color="#2b3152" font_size="30" line_height="184" use_theme_fonts="" google_fonts_text="font_family:Montserrat%3Aregular%2C700|font_style:700%20bold%20regular%3A700%3Anormal"]Contact Me[/gt3_custom_text][gt3_spacing height="23px"][contact-form-7 id="1053"][gt3_spacing height="80px"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
